org.epochx.core
Class Model

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.core.Model
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GEModel, GPModel, GRModel
public abstract class Model
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

Implementations of Model define a configuration for a set of evolutionary runs and provide the means to execute the runs. Instances of model need to provide the components, control parameters and other settings that the framework needs to evolve. The Model also provides the fitness function against which all programs will be evaluated.

Prior to calling the run method it is typical to arrange for some form of output to be generated each generation, each run or even each crossover or mutation. A wide range of statistics are available from the StatsManager. A listener model is employed through the LifeCycleManager to allow events such as a generation starting, or crossover being carried out, to be handled and responded to. This is commonly combined with the StatsManager to output statistics each generation or run. Instances of both these class are obtainable from a model.

The Model class implements Runnable. Because of this, it is possible to run a model in its own thread simply by passing it to a thread object which is then started.

new Thread(model).start();

Despite this, the current version of the Model class is not threadsafe, so it is not advisable to start the same model multiple times concurrently.

See Also:
StatsManager, LifeCycleManager

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

run

public void run()
Executes this model to perform a series of evolutionary runs.

Calling this method directly will run this model sequentially, or it can be passed into a new thread object whose start() method is then called to run this model in a new thread. A checks is performed after running the configure event that the model is in a runnable state. A model is in a runnable state if all compulsory control parameters and operators have been set. If it is not in a runnable state then an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

Returns:
the run manager that will handle execution of evolutionary runs.

getFitness

public abstract double getFitness(CandidateProgram program)
Calculates a fitness score of a program. In EpochX fitness is standardised so a fitness score of 0.1 is better than 0.2. It is essential that this method is implemented to provide a measure of how good the given program solution is.

Parameters:
program - the candidate program to be evaluated.
Returns:
a fitness score for the program given as a parameter.

cacheFitness

public boolean cacheFitness()
Returns whether fitness caching is to be used or not. Fitness caching should be used for most problems but if the same source code can be designated different fitness scores (due to the fitness being dependent upon other properties) then fitness caching should be disabled.

Defaults to true.

Returns:
true if fitness caching should be used, false otherwise.

setCacheFitness

public void setCacheFitness(boolean cacheFitness)
Overwrites the default setting of whether to cache the fitness values.

Parameters:
cacheFitness - whether fitnesses should be cached or not.

getNoRuns

public int getNoRuns()
Returns the number of separate runs that will be carried out with this model.

Defaults to 1.

Returns:
the number of runs that will be performed.

setNoRuns

public void setNoRuns(int noRuns)
Overwrites the default number of runs.

Parameters:
noRuns - the new number of runs to execute with this model.

getNoGenerations

public int getNoGenerations()
Returns the maximum number of generations that each run will contain. Termination may be caused by other criteria such as fitness.

Defaults to 50.

Returns:
the maximum number of generations that will be performed in a run before termination.

setNoGenerations

public void setNoGenerations(int noGenerations)
Overwrites the default number of generations.

Parameters:
noGenerations - the new number of generations to use within a run.

public int getPopulationSize()
Specifies the number of programs to maintain in the population.

Defaults to 100.

Returns:
the size of the population to be used.

Overwrites the default population size of CandidatePrograms.

Parameters:

getPoolSize

public int getPoolSize()
Returns the size of the breeding pool to use. If a value of zero or less is returned then the whole population will be used as the pool.

Defaults to 50.

Returns:
the number of programs that should form the breeding pool.

setPoolSize

public void setPoolSize(int poolSize)
Overwrites the default pool size value.

Parameters:
poolSize - the new size of the mating pool to use.

getNoElites

public int getNoElites()
Returns the number of elite programs to be copied directly into each generation, where elites are the very best programs in a population.

Defaults to 10.

Returns:
the number of elites to be used each generation.

setNoElites

public void setNoElites(int noElites)
Overwrites the default number of elites to copy from one generation to the next.

Parameters:
noElites - the new number of elites to copy across from one population to the next.

getCrossoverProbability

public double getCrossoverProbability()
Returns the probability that when choosing how the next programs will be generated, whether crossover will be used. The probabilities of crossover, mutation and reproduction should add up to 1.0. If the probabilities do not add up then crossover will be given the priority, followed by mutation, with the remaining probability left to reproduction.

Defaults to 0.9 to represent a 90% chance.

Returns:
the probability that the crossover operation will be carried out.

setCrossoverProbability

public void setCrossoverProbability(double crossoverProbability)
Overwrites the default Crossover probability.

Parameters:
crossoverProbability - the new Crossover probability to use.

getMutationProbability

public double getMutationProbability()
Returns the probability that when choosing how the next programs will be generated, whether mutation will be used. The probabilities of crossover, mutation and reproduction should add up to 1.0. If the probabilities do not add up then crossover will be given the priority, followed by mutation, with the remaining probability left to reproduction.

Defaults to 0.1 to represent a 10% chance.

Returns:
the probability that the mutation operation will be carried out.

setMutationProbability

public void setMutationProbability(double mutationProbability)
Overwrites the default mutation probability.

Parameters:
mutationProbability - the new mutation probability to use.

getReproductionProbability

public double getReproductionProbability()
Returns the probability that when choosing how the next programs will be generated, whether reproduction will be used. The probabilities of crossover, mutation and reproduction should add up to 1.0. If the probabilities do not add up then crossover will be given the priority, followed by mutation, with the remaining probability left to reproduction.

Returns:
the probability that the reproduction operation will be carried out.

setReproductionProbability

public void setReproductionProbability(double reproductionProbability)
Overwrites the default reproduction probability.

Parameters:
reproductionProbability - the new reproduction probability to use.

getTerminationFitness

public double getTerminationFitness()
Returns the target fitness score. The current run will be terminated if a fitness score equal to or less than this value is achieved. If this happens the run will be considered a success. If the implementer doesn't wish to use a fitness termination criterion then a fitness score lower than the lowest possible value should be used, such as Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.

Defaults to 0.0.

Returns:
the fitness score that will be used as the fitness termination criterion.

setTerminationFitness

public void setTerminationFitness(double terminationFitness)
Overwrites the default fitness for run termination.

Parameters:
terminationFitness - the new fitness below which a run will be terminated.

getProgramSelector

public ProgramSelector getProgramSelector()
Returns the component to be used to select individual programs from a breeding pool to undergo operations such as crossover and mutation.

Defaults to an instance of TournamentSelector with a tournament size of 7.

Returns:
the ProgramSelector that will be used to select the programs to undergo operations.

setProgramSelector

public void setProgramSelector(ProgramSelector programSelector)
Overwrites the default parent selector used to select parents to undergo a genetic operator from either a pool or the previous population.

Parameters:
programSelector - the new ProgramSelector to be used when selecting parents for a genetic operator.

getPoolSelector

public PoolSelector getPoolSelector()
Returns the component to perform the selection of a breeding pool. A null pool selector will result in no pool selection being performed, and programs will be selected directly from the population.

Defaults to null.

Returns:
the PoolSelector that will select the breeding pool of programs.

setPoolSelector

public void setPoolSelector(PoolSelector poolSelector)
Overwrites the default pool selector used to generate a mating pool.

Parameters:
poolSelector - the new PoolSelector to be used when building a breeding pool

getRNG

public RandomNumberGenerator getRNG()
Returns the random number generator that to be responsible for determining random behaviour. It is important that the random number generator is not unnecessary re-constructed on each call to this method as that could reduce the quality of the random numbers.

Evolutionary algorithms are inherently non-deterministic, so the result of multiple calls to the run method with identical models will naturally produce different results if the random number generator in use by the model is seeded differently.

Defaults to MersenneTwisterFast.

Returns:
the random number generator to be provide the random numbers.

setRNG

public void setRNG(RandomNumberGenerator rng)
Overwrites the default random number generator used to generate random numbers to control behaviour throughout a run.

Parameters:
rng - the random number generator to be used any time random behaviour is required.
